greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered labeled rooted trees on n nodes with non-leaf nodes having more than two children.
comment: The correspondence between rooted trees and dissection of (n+1)-gon as in A046736 is just like the case for Catalan numbers and binary trees.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..370
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 94
formula: E.g.f.: A(x)=sum_{n>0} a(n)*x^n/n! satisfies A(x)-A(x)^2-A(x)^3 = x*(1-A(x)).

a(n) ~ n^(n-1) * sqrt(r*(1-s)/(2+6*s)) / (exp(n) * r^n), where r = 0.2933671276754004454... is the root of the equation 5-8*r-32*r^2+4*r^3 = 0 and s = 0.40303171676268477587... is the root of the equation 1-2*s-2*s^2+2*s^3 = 0. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 08 2014
mathematica: CoefficientList[InverseSeries[Series[1 + 1/(x-1) + 2*x + x^2, {x,0,20}], x], x] * Range[0,20]! (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 08 2014 *)
results.author: encyclopedia(AT)pommard.inria.fr, Jan 25 2000
